alert.note: Alert for Baldwin (Alabama) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Advisory issued June 18 at 11:04AM CDT by NWS Mobile
info.description: ...FLOOD ADVISORY IN EFFECT UNTIL 215 PM CDT THIS AFTERNOON... * WHAT...Urban and small stream flooding caused by excessive rainfall is expected. * WHERE...Portions of southwest Alabama and northwest Florida, including the following counties, in southwest Alabama, Baldwin. In northwest Florida, Escambia. * WHEN...Until 215 PM CDT. * IMPACTS...Minor flooding in low-lying and poor drainage areas. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 1104 AM CDT, Doppler radar indicated heavy rain due to thunderstorms. This will cause urban and small stream flooding. Between 1 and 3 inches of rain have fallen. - Additional rainfall amounts of 1 to 3 inches are expected over the area. This additional rain will result in minor flooding. - Some locations that will experience flooding include... Pensacola, Ferry Pass, Brent, West Pensacola, Ensley, Daphne, Warrington, Fairhope, Gonzalez, Gulf Shores, Foley, Orange Beach, Goulding, Robertsdale, Point Clear, Loxley, Lillian, Myrtle Grove, Magnolia Springs and Bon Secour.
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles.
